derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hæsel, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch hazelaar 'hazel tree', hazelnoot 'hazelnut', and German Hasel, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin corylus

entry.def: A hazel is a small tree which produces nuts that you can eat.
Hazel eyes are greenish-brown in colour.

means.word_mean: 1. Australian tree grown especially for ornament and its fine-grained wood and bearing edible nuts
2. the fine-grained wood of a hazelnut tree (genus Corylus) and the hazel tree (Australian genus Pomaderris)
3. any of several shrubs or small trees of the genus Corylus bearing edible nuts enclosed in a leafy husk
1. of a light brown or yellowish brown color
